data.text: Wise women build houses:
He that walks uprightly fears the Lord;
Out of the mouth of fools comes a rod of pride;
Where no oxen are, the cribs are clean;
A faithful witness does not lie;
Thou shalt seek wisdom with bad men, and shalt not find it;
All things are adverse to a foolish man;
The wisdom of the prudent will understand their ways;
The houses of transgressors will need purification;
If a manâ€™s mind is intelligent, his soul is sorrowful;
The houses of ungodly men shall be utterly destroyed;
There is a way which seems to be right with men,
Grief mingles not with mirth;
A stouthearted man shall be filled with his own ways;
The simple believes every word:
A wise man fears, and departs from evil;
A passionate man acts inconsiderately;
Fools shall have mischief for their portion;
Evil men shall fall before the good;
Friends will hate poor friends;
He that dishonors the needy sins:
They that go astray devise evils:
With everyone who is careful there is abundance:
A prudent man is the crown of the wise:
A faithful witness shall deliver a soul from evil:
In the fear of the Lord is strong confidence:
The commandment of the Lord is a fountain of life;
In a populous nation is the glory of a king:
A man slow to wrath abounds in wisdom:
A meek-spirited man is a healer of the heart:
He that oppresses the needy provokes his Maker:
The ungodly shall be driven away in his wickedness:
There is wisdom in the good heart of a man:
Righteousness exalts a nation:
An understanding servant is acceptable to a king;
